node.title: Material property 'matpp', requested by 'max_stress_excess' is not defined on
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
in my simulation I need to track a material property by which to stop/start a step e.g. stoping injection or production from a geothermal reservoir. To track the material property, I have tried to use "ElementExtremeMaterialProperty" like the following but i faced up with an error.
here is the a part of input file:
[Materials]
[failure]
type = TigerFailure
block = 'fault_left fault_right fault_mid fault_bottom'
property_name = 'matpp'
outputs = exodus
[]
[]
[Postprocessors]
[./max_stress_excess]
type = ElementExtremeMaterialProperty
mat_prop = matpp
value_type = max
execute_on = ' timestep_end'
block = 'fault_left fault_right fault_mid fault_bottom'
[../]
[]
and here is the error:
Material property 'matpp', requested by 'max_stress_excess' is not defined on fault_left fault_right fault_mid fault_bottom
Thanks in advance
Rahim

Hello
Are these locations for the postprocessor sidesets?
I think you may need to pass an extra parameter to get material properties defined on sidesets
Can you please check the Material main documentation page?
guillaume

Thanks Guillaume,
They are not sidesets. Actually they are 2D elements attached to sidesets.
what parameter has to be passed? I looked for it here: https://mooseframework.inl.gov/syntax/Materials/index.html , but could not find.
Rahim

Can you use Debug/show_material_props to check that the names of the properties declared and used match?
And check the block restrictions

I just add debug block in input file. The following shows the debug/show_material-props for "fault_bottom". I got the same for other subdomins i.e. fault_left fault_right fault_mid.

the parameter (Coulomb_Stress) I want to track on shows up here. but I got the error.

It is noted that TigerFailure is a custom material class created by you. In its source file (TigerFailure.C ), you should have already computed and declared some properties you need, taking diffusivity and density as examples：
_diffusivity(declareProperty<Real>("diffusivity")),
_density(declareProperty<Real>("density")),

Then if you want to track the maximum value of diffusivity, you can use this:
[Materials]
  [failure]
    type = TigerFailure
    block = 'fault_left fault_right fault_mid fault_bottom'
    #property_name = 'matpp'   #comment out this line
    #outputs = exodus         #comment out this line
  []
[]

[Postprocessors]
  [./max_stress_excess]
      type = ElementExtremeMaterialProperty
      mat_prop = diffusivity    # the property you declare in the source file
      value_type = max
      execute_on = ' timestep_end'
      block = 'fault_left fault_right fault_mid fault_bottom'
  [../]
[]

which material is supposed to be declaring matpp ? I dont see it in the Debug log.
Could you please paste it as text next time, makes searching easier. With triple back-quotes, the formatting of text is fairly decent

Thanks @echo1115
It works in this way. But i did not expect it in this way because here (https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/postprocessors/ElementExtremeMaterialProperty.html), it is mentioned to use "property_name". I followed the examples there.
Any way, thanks.
@GiudGiud you can close the discussion, the error did not show up after applying @echo1115 suggestion.
Rahim

node.title: CZM Interface damage always shows zero
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
To study the separation of interface between two connected objects (block1-block2), I fixed the bottom of block2 and applied a displacement load boundary condition at the upper edge of block1.

When the computation is complete, the interface separation is observed from Paraview

But when I output the maximum value of the material property 'damage' at the interface, it remains 0.
...
Time Step 100, time = 1, dt = 0.01
 0 Nonlinear |R| = 2.626068e-09
      0 Linear |R| = 2.626068e-09
      1 Linear |R| = 1.425100e-23
 1 Nonlinear |R| = 2.222906e-12
      0 Linear |R| = 2.222906e-12
      1 Linear |R| = 1.389330e-26
 2 Nonlinear |R| = 2.013779e-18
 Solve Converged!

Outlier Variable Residual Norms:
  disp_y: 1.971589e-18

Postprocessor Values:
+----------------+----------------------+----------------+
| time           | interface_damage_max | load           |
+----------------+----------------------+----------------+
:                :                      :                :
|   8.600000e-01 |         0.000000e+00 |   8.600000e-07 |
|   8.700000e-01 |         0.000000e+00 |   8.700000e-07 |
|   8.800000e-01 |         0.000000e+00 |   8.800000e-07 |
|   8.900000e-01 |         0.000000e+00 |   8.900000e-07 |
|   9.000000e-01 |         0.000000e+00 |   9.000000e-07 |
|   9.100000e-01 |         0.000000e+00 |   9.100000e-07 |
|   9.200000e-01 |         0.000000e+00 |   9.200000e-07 |
|   9.300000e-01 |         0.000000e+00 |   9.300000e-07 |
|   9.400000e-01 |         0.000000e+00 |   9.400000e-07 |
|   9.500000e-01 |         0.000000e+00 |   9.500000e-07 |
|   9.600000e-01 |         0.000000e+00 |   9.600000e-07 |
|   9.700000e-01 |         0.000000e+00 |   9.700000e-07 |
|   9.800000e-01 |         0.000000e+00 |   9.800000e-07 |
|   9.900000e-01 |         0.000000e+00 |   9.900000e-07 |
|   1.000000e+00 |         0.000000e+00 |   1.000000e-06 |
+----------------+----------------------+----------------+


Here shows my input:
[Mesh]
  [gmg]
    type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
    dim = 3
    xmax = 400
    ymax = 40
    zmax = 200
    nx = 20
    ny = 10
    nz = 15
  []
  [add_subdomain_1]
    type = SubdomainBoundingBoxGenerator
    input = gmg
    block_id = 1
    bottom_left = '0 20 0'
    top_right = '400 40 200'
  []
  [add_subdomain_2]
    type = SubdomainBoundingBoxGenerator
    input = add_subdomain_1
    block_id = 2
    bottom_left = '0 0 0'
    top_right = '400 20 200'
  []
  [split]
    type = BreakMeshByBlockGenerator
    input = add_subdomain_2
    show_info = true
  []
  [top_line]
    type = BoundingBoxNodeSetGenerator
    input = split
    bottom_left = '0 40 0'
    top_right = '0 40 200'
    new_boundary = 'top_line' #nodes_to_convert_to_sides
  []
  [create_sideset]
    type = SideSetsFromNodeSetsGenerator
    input = top_line
  []
  [scale]
    type = TransformGenerator
    input = create_sideset
    transform = SCALE
    vector_value ='1e-6 1e-6 1e-6'
  []
[]

[GlobalParams]
  displacements = 'disp_x disp_y disp_z'
[]
        
[Variables]
  [./disp_x]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
  [../]
  [./disp_y]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
  [../]
  [./disp_z]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
  [../]
[]

[AuxVariables]
  [./damage]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
  [../]
[]

[Functions]            
  [function_load]
    type = ParsedFunction
    expression = '1.0e-6*t'   
  []   
[]
    
[Kernels]
  [./TensorMechanics]
    use_displaced_mesh = true
  [../]
[]

[Modules/TensorMechanics/CohesiveZoneMaster]
  [./czm]
    strain = FINITE
    boundary = 'interface'
  [../]
[]

[AuxKernels]
  [./damage]
    type = MaterialRealAux
    variable = damage
    property = damage
    #execute_on = timestep_end
    boundary = ' interface'
  [../]    
[]

[BCs]
  [./fix_bottom_x]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = disp_x
    boundary = 'bottom'
    value = 0.0
  [../]
  [./fix_bottom_y]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = disp_y
    boundary = 'bottom'
    value = 0.0
  [../]
  [./fix_bottom_z]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = disp_z
    boundary = 'bottom'
    value = 0.0
  [../]

  [./top]
    type = FunctionDirichletBC
    function = function_load
    variable = disp_y
    boundary = 'top_line'
  [../]
[]


[Materials]
  [./czm]
    type = BiLinearMixedModeTraction
    penalty_stiffness = 1.0e15 
    GI_c = 25 
    GII_c = 25 
    normal_strength = 100e6
    shear_strength = 100e6 
    eta = 2
    mixed_mode_criterion = POWER_LAW
    boundary = 'interface'
  [../]  
  [./block1_Ev]
    type =ComputeIsotropicElasticityTensor
    youngs_modulus = 4.74e10
    poissons_ratio = 0.23
    block = 1
  [../]
  [./block2_Ev]
    type =ComputeIsotropicElasticityTensor
    block = 2
    youngs_modulus = 3.4e11
    poissons_ratio = 0.13
  [../]
  [./stress]
    type = ComputeFiniteStrainElasticStress
    block = '1 2'
  [../] 
  [./strain]
    type = ComputeFiniteStrain
    block = '1 2'
  [../]
[]

[Postprocessors]
  [load]
    type = FunctionValuePostprocessor
    function = function_load
  []
    [./interface_damage_max]
      type = SideExtremeValue
      value_type = max
      variable = damage
      boundary = interface
    [../]
[]


[Preconditioning]
  [./smp]
    type = SMP
    full = true
  [../]
[]

[Problem]
    type = ReferenceResidualProblem
[]

[Outputs]
  perf_graph = true
  interval = 1
  csv = true
  exodus = true
[]   


[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  solve_type = 'NEWTON'
  line_search = none

  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type'
  petsc_options_value = 'lu'

  automatic_scaling = true

  l_max_its = 2
  l_tol = 1e-14
  nl_max_its = 30
  nl_rel_tol = 1e-50
  nl_abs_tol = 1e-15
  start_time = 0.0
  dt = 0.01
  end_time = 1.0 
  dtmin = 0.01
[]

Hello,
Were you able to find a solution to this?
Sorry, I haven't found a solution yet.

If I recall correctly, we do not store the damage quantity on the interface/boundary. We save it as an AuxVariable. Try to output elemental value (rather than side value) of damage in the post processor.

Thanks for your suggestion @jiangwen84
In AuxKernels, the boundary = ' interface' must be set, otherwise it would shows:
*** ERROR ***
The following error occurred in the object "MOOSE Problem", of type "ReferenceResidualProblem".

Material property 'damage', requested by 'damage' is not defined on block 1
Material property 'damage', requested by 'damage' is not defined on block 2

Then I try to output elemental value of damage  in post processor:
  [./damage_max_block1]
    type = ElementExtremeValue
    variable = damage
    value_type = max
    block = 1
  [../]
   [./damage_max_block2]
    type = ElementExtremeValue
    variable = damage
    value_type = max
    block = 2
  [../]
  [./damage_max]
    type = ElementExtremeValue
    variable = damage
    value_type = max
  [../]

but it still outputs zero:
Postprocessor Values:
+----------------+----------------+-------------------+-------------------+----------------+
| time           | damage_max     | damage_max_block1 | damage_max_block2 | load           |

|   1.910000e+00 |   0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |   1.910000e-06 |
|   1.920000e+00 |   0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |   1.920000e-06 |
|   1.930000e+00 |   0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |   1.930000e-06 |
|   1.940000e+00 |   0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |   1.940000e-06 |
|   1.950000e+00 |   0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |   1.950000e-06 |
|   1.960000e+00 |   0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |   1.960000e-06 |
|   1.970000e+00 |   0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |   1.970000e-06 |
|   1.980000e+00 |   0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |   1.980000e-06 |
|   1.990000e+00 |   0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |   1.990000e-06 |
|   2.000000e+00 |   0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |      0.000000e+00 |   2.000000e-06 |
+----------------+----------------+-------------------+-------------------+----------------+

It worked for me using this :
[AuxVariables]
   [damage]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
  [../]
[]

[AuxKernels]
  [damage]
    type = MaterialRealAux
    variable = damage
    property = damage
    execute_on = timestep_end
    boundary = ' interface'
  [../]
[]

[Postprocessors]
  [damage]
    type = ElementAverageValue
    variable = damage
  [../]
[]

It took some time though for the damage to increase, but I guess this has to do with my material properties.
Thanks @amassaf , I tried ElementAverageValue but it still shows zero. Maybe there is something wrong with my input file, but I can't find it.

Even when I tried to output damage in moose's built-in example bilinear_mixed_scale_strength.i, it was also 0.
Here is the input of bilinear_mixed_scale_strength.i :
[Mesh]
  [msh]
    type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
    dim = 2
    xmax = 1
    ymax = 2
    nx = 5
    ny = 10
  []
  [block1]
    type = SubdomainBoundingBoxGenerator
    input = 'msh'
    bottom_left = '0 0 0'
    top_right = '1 1 0'
    block_id = 1
    block_name = 'block1'
  []
  [block2]
    type = SubdomainBoundingBoxGenerator
    input = 'block1'
    bottom_left = '0 1 0'
    top_right = '1 2 0'
    block_id = 2
    block_name = 'block2'
  []
  [split]
    type = BreakMeshByBlockGenerator
    input = block2
  []
  [top_node]
    type = ExtraNodesetGenerator
    coord = '0 2 0'
    input = split
    new_boundary = top_node
  []
  [bottom_node]
    type = ExtraNodesetGenerator
    coord = '0 0 0'
    input = top_node
    new_boundary = bottom_node
  []
[]

[GlobalParams]
  displacements = 'disp_x disp_y'
[]

[Modules]
  [TensorMechanics]
    [Master]
      generate_output = 'stress_yy'
      [all]
        strain = FINITE
        add_variables = true
        use_automatic_differentiation = true
        decomposition_method = TaylorExpansion
      []
    []
  []
[]

[BCs]
  [fix_x]
    type = DirichletBC
    preset = true
    value = 0.0
    boundary = bottom_node
    variable = disp_x
  []

  [fix_top]
    type = DirichletBC
    preset = true
    boundary = top
    variable = disp_x
    value = 0
  []

  [top]
    type = FunctionDirichletBC
    boundary = top
    variable = disp_y
    function = 'if(t<=0.3,t,if(t<=0.6,0.3-(t-0.3),0.6-t))'
    preset = true
  []

  [bottom]
    type = DirichletBC
    boundary = bottom
    variable = disp_y
    value = 0
    preset = true
  []
[]

[AuxVariables]
  [mode_mixity_ratio]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
  []
  [damage]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
  []
[]

[AuxKernels]
  [mode_mixity_ratio]
    type = MaterialRealAux
    variable = mode_mixity_ratio
    property = mode_mixity_ratio
    execute_on = timestep_end
    boundary = interface
  []
  [damage]
    type = MaterialRealAux
    variable = damage
    property = damage
    execute_on = timestep_end
    boundary = interface
  []
[]

[Modules/TensorMechanics/CohesiveZoneMaster]
  [czm_ik]
    boundary = 'interface'
  []
[]

[Materials]
  [stress]
    type = ADComputeFiniteStrainElasticStress
  []
  [elasticity_tensor]
    type = ADComputeElasticityTensor
    fill_method = symmetric9
    C_ijkl = '1.684e5 0.176e5 0.176e5 1.684e5 0.176e5 1.684e5 0.754e5 0.754e5 0.754e5'
  []
  [normal_strength]
    type = GenericFunctionMaterial
    prop_names = 'N'
    prop_values = 'if(x<0.5,1,100)*1e4'
  []
  [czm]
    type = BiLinearMixedModeTraction
    boundary = 'interface'
    penalty_stiffness = 1e6
    GI_c = 1e3
    GII_c = 1e2
    normal_strength = N
    shear_strength = 1e3
    displacements = 'disp_x disp_y'
    eta = 2.2
    viscosity = 1e-3
  []
[]

[Postprocessors] #added
  [./damage_max]
    type = ElementExtremeValue
    variable = damage
    value_type = max
  [../]
  [./damage_ave]
    type = ElementAverageValue
    variable = damage
  [../]
[]

[Preconditioning]
  [smp]
    type = SMP
    full = true
  []
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient

  solve_type = 'NEWTON'
  line_search = none

  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type'
  petsc_options_value = 'lu'

  automatic_scaling = true

  l_max_its = 2
  l_tol = 1e-14
  nl_max_its = 30
  nl_rel_tol = 1e-10
  nl_abs_tol = 1e-10
  start_time = 0.0
  dt = 0.01
  end_time = 0.05
  dtmin = 0.01
[]

[Outputs]
  exodus = true
[]
It also works using the ElementExtremeValue ofc

Thanks for your reply! @amassaf After increasing the end_time, I found that not only is the use of elemental value, using SideExtremeValue or InterfaceAverageVariableValuePostprocessor also can see the damage output.
Now there is another question that makes me confused:
when t=0.1, the damage in case bilinear_mixed_scale_strength.i is 0, but from paraview, the interface looks has been separated, is this just a visual illusion?

I think this is due to the material property... the damage will only be >0 if delta_m > delta_0 and the set penalty stiffness and normal/shear strength would give a delta around 1e-2 which is whydamage will be > 0 when delta_m > 1e-2

Thank you! @amassaf
I understand that damage will only be greater than 0 when _delta_m is greater than _delta_init, and the interface will split when the damage reaches 1.
$\delta_m^{max}>\delta_m^0\to$ $damage>0$ $\dots$ then  $damage=1\to 'interface-split'$
My question is that I seem to have seen 'interface-split' in paraview at t=0.1, but  the damage doesn't reach 1, so the  'interface-split'  is actually an illusion?
@jiangwen84 @GiudGiud
Not my field of expertise sorry

node.title: Convergence Issues for Multiapp Fracture Flow Example with Multiphase Mass Transfer
node.bodyText:
Dear MOOSE experts,
I'm currently trying to adopt the Multiapp Fracture Flow Example for use in a larger project concerning CO2 injection into supercritical water. I was able to implement mass transfer as suggested in the corresponding section, but I keep running into convergence issues.
All files can be found in the following repository: https://github.com/zerog981/moose-fracture-example
The original example is bundled with Moose (https://github.com/idaholab/moose/tree/next/modules/porous_flow/examples/multiapp_fracture_flow/3dFracture).
Here is a list of variations I tried:

All different sizes of meshes.
Reducing Nonlinear absolute tolerance down to 1e-4 with no success.
Changing fluid properties to SimpleFluidProperties. This does improve the situation, but being in the supercritical region requires more accurate equations of state. I also tried using TabulatedFluidProperties, but then I get errors about MOOSE trying to sample out of range.
If mass transfer is deactivated and only conductive heat transfer is considered, the simulation runs without problems.
Instead of including the varying fracture porosity from the example, I assumed constant aperture for simplification (knowing that this is quite different in reality).

Before crashing, the exchange of gas into the matrix is clearly visible (after about 170s into the simulation):

I'm still quite new to MOOSE and this is my first project, so any help or guidance is highly appreciated. Please tell me if you need more information.
This is the log:
failure.log

Hello

but then I get errors about MOOSE trying to sample out of range.

did you try to extend the range of the tabulations? also these might not matter if the final converged values are within range.
The nonlinear solver can visit non-physical regions during the iteration process.
Can you try some of the techniques in there and report back?
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/moose/application_usage/failed_solves.html
Guillaume

Thank you @GiudGiud for your swift reply, yes, I tried extending the range already to the maximum without success. In the end I was using the EOS objects directly (CO2FluidProperties and Water97FluidProperties).

https://mooseframework.inl.gov/moose/application_usage/failed_solves.html
I'm aware of that page, but I went through it again:


Initial conditions seem to be fine to me
I tried including line_search = 'none' without success
From show_var_residual_norms I saw that temperature residuals are off by 5-6 orders of magnitude (despite automatic_scaling being true). So I added temperature scaling of 1e-6 and deactivated automatic scaling. The convergence issue is not affected by this.

Chris

did you try reducing the problem to a few thousand DOFs and check if SVD gets you a decent condition number
is the linear solve or the nonlinear solve not converging?

I used a strong machine to not have to reduce the DOFs (cannot edit the fracture network meshing), and I got condition numbers as high as 1e12 (fracture network) and 1e11 (matrix). I suppose that's too high?
Occasionally I see linear solves fail, but this is solved after one timestep cut. The real failure is caused by the nonlinear solve not converging.
As reference for SVD: https://mooseframework.inl.gov/moose/application_usage/failed_solves.html

1e12 might be fine actually. Maybe with a customized nonlinear scaling (scaling parameter for each parameter) you might be able to get convergence?
Using Debug/show_var_residual_norms can you find a few good scaling parameters for each variable (equation really)

node.title: Combining two sets of meshs with overlapping.
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I am having trouble combining two sets of mesh models that I extracted from images. Both sets are the same size and represent different parts of an object, but they share a common region in both images. As shown in attached file, my original structure has three revgions. To have a correct mesh, I divided the structure to two parts (righ hand side image of attached files). I got two separate meshs (each 1000 elements) for these images and then I combineed them, followed by renaming the block IDs. After the combing it seems that two sets of meshes are not merged together and the number of elements were doubled (2000 elements). How can I correct it?
Thanks.

Following is the code:

[Mesh]
    [generate]
    type = FileMeshGenerator
    file = image_2d_out1.e
    []
    [image]
      type = ImageSubdomainGenerator
      input = generate
      threshold = 90
      file = 1.png
    []
    [interface]
      type = SideSetsBetweenSubdomainsGenerator
      input = image
      primary_block = 0
      paired_block = 1
      new_boundary = 10
    []
    [generate1]
      type = FileMeshGenerator
      file = image_2d_out2.e
      []
      [image1]
        type = ImageSubdomainGenerator
        input = generate1
       threshold = 90   
      file = 2.png
      []
      [interface1]
        type = SideSetsBetweenSubdomainsGenerator
        input = image1
        primary_block = 0
        paired_block = 1
        new_boundary = 10
      []
    [next1]
      type = RenameBlockGenerator
      input = interface1
      old_block = '0 1'
      new_block = '0 2'
    []
    [cmn]
      type = CombinerGenerator
      inputs = 'interface next1'
    []
  []
  [Variables]
    [u]
    []
  []
  [Problem]
    type = FEProblem
    solve = false
  []
  [Executioner]
    type = Steady
  []
  [Outputs]
    file_base = image_meshsecond
    execute_on = 'timestep_end'
    exodus = true
  []

image_2d_out1.e and  image_2d_out2.e were also generated by this code (I checked and they were correct):
[Mesh]
  [gen]
    type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
    dim = 2
    nx = 100
    ny = 100  []
  [image]
    input = gen
    type = ImageSubdomainGenerator
    file = 2.png
    file_suffix = png
    threshold = 90
  []
[]
[Variables]
  [u]
  []
[]
[Problem]
  type = FEProblem
  solve = false
[]
[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  num_steps = 1
  dt = 0.1
[]
[Outputs]
  exodus = true
[]

Hello
The overlap must be removed from the mesh, you can’t have overlapping elements during the simulation.
The meshRepairGenerator might be able to help, once the mesh is stitched properly.
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/meshgenerators/MeshRepairGenerator.html
you ll want to use a StitchedMeshGenerator instead of the combiner to make sure the meshes get properly attached
Guillaume

node.title: How to convert the value of AuxVariable to [Function] block?
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
I would like to convert AuxVariable value to a function, and then use this function in [Pressure] block of SolidMechanics Module. But I cannot find any type of function to do this.
Could anyone kindly help me? Thanks!
I think you can use the https://mooseframework.inl.gov/syntax/BCs/CoupledPressure/ action instead. This uses the AuxVariable directly.
Thanks!
Yeah functions cannot depend on variables. They should only depend on space and time

node.title: UserObject with an list of sub-objects
node.bodyText:
Dear Moose community,
I'd like to build an UserObject with an list of nested sub-objects. I hope you can point me in the right direction.
I know how to register register 'simple' parameters for a user object, e.g.:
  params.addParam<FileName>("data_file", "File holding CSV data");
This allows me to use this parameter in my input file (*.i - file) like this:
  [UserObjects]
    [MyUserObject1]
      type = 'MyUserObject'
      data_file = 'bla.txt'
    []
  []

Now I want to build something like this: my user object contains a list of sub-objects beside my 'regular' properties
  [UserObjects]
    [MyUserObject1]
      type = 'MyUserObjectType'
      data_file = 'bla.txt'
      [MySubObject1]
        type = 'MySubObjectTypeA'
        propA = 'blubb'
      []
      [MySubObject2]
        type = 'MySubObjectTypeB'
        propY = 888
      []
      [MySubObject2]
        type = 'MySubObjectTypeC'
        propZ = 123.2
      []
      # any more sub-objects as desired by the user...
    []
  []

In my c++ object of type 'MyUserObjectType' it would be nice to have all sub-objects in an list/array/vector.
How can I realize this?
Kind regards,
Jörg

Hello
You want to create a new Action. See this page
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/actions/Action.html
and this part of the tutorial:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/workshop/index.html#/57
You probably want to create a new syntax for adding user objects. In this case I would recommend differentiating it from our
[UserObjects]

block to avoid confusion and to avoid having the Parser read [UserObjects/MyUserObject] and create a regular user object.
So maybe
[NestedUserObjects]
  [parent_uo]
    [child1]
    []
    [child2]
    []
  []
[]

Dear @GiudGiud
In the action (more specific in the "act" method) creating "child1" and "child2", how do I get the superordinated "parent_uo"? I know about _type and _name - but how about the "parent"?

Not sure but I would try

action warehouse to get the name of the current syntax (might have to use the task for that)
Get the user object (a pointer to) from the problem

Thanks for the help, @GiudGiud. Now I do the following (within the act method):

From the action warehouse I get the current action name (getCurrentActionName). For child1 this string reads NestedUserObjects/parent_uo/child1
One can split this string using / as a delimiter.
Using _problem->getUserObject<...>("parent_uo") one can now get the parental user object.

node.title: Convergence issue
node.bodyText:
I'm making phase-field based app using KKS. However, the solution does not converge. Also, there is error related with ConstantDT. Could you give me some help? This is the output message :
Time Step 1, time = 1.49012e-12, dt = 1.49012e-12
0 Nonlinear |R| = 1.920919e-05
Linear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_PC_FAILED iterations 0
PC failed due to FACTOR_NUMERIC_ZEROPIVOT
Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_LOCAL_MIN iterations 0
Solve Did NOT Converge!
Aborting as solve did not converge
Time Step 1, time = 1e-12, dt = 1e-12
0 Nonlinear |R| = 1.920919e-05
Linear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_PC_FAILED iterations 0
PC failed due to FACTOR_NUMERIC_ZEROPIVOT
Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_LOCAL_MIN iterations 0
Solve Did NOT Converge!
Aborting as solve did not converge
*** ERROR ***
The following error occurred in the object "ConstantDT", of type "ConstantDT".
Solve failed and timestep already at or below dtmin, cannot continue!
I'll attach full input file.
redistribution.txt

Hello
Please follow the advice on the troubleshooting failed page on the moose website and report on what you tried
Guillaume

Sorry for late.
I tried some method. There is issue on initial condition & unit system.
Actually, I have another question in Cahn-Hilliard equation.
What I want is that adapting temperature gradient effect on Cahn-Hilliard equation.
This is the equation.

How can I add temperature gradient effect in MOOSE?
Thank you.
Woojin

Hello
You'll want to create a new kernel if there is none implemented in the phase field module.
This does not seem too complex to implement but it would be worth looking through examples. Search for a "T" or "temperature" variable defined in CH inputs
Guillaume

Thank you for replying.
I'm not making kernel for that. But I'm just wondering that is it possible to adapt like this?
  [./CHBulk]
    type = KKSSplitCHCRes
    variable = c
    ca       = cab
    fa_name  = fab
    w        = w
  [../]

  [./SoretDiffusion]
    type = SoretDiffusion
    variable = w
    c = c
    T = T
    diff_name = M_t
    Q_name = Qstar
  [../]

  [./dcdt]
    type = CoupledTimeDerivative
    variable = w
    v = c
  [../]
  [./ckernel]
    type = SplitCHWRes
    mob_name = M
    variable = w
  [../]

  [./HeatConduction]
    type = MatDiffusion
    variable = T
    diffusivity = k
  [../]

I'm really appreciate to your answer.
Woojin

Hello
I dont see the M_c term? Maybe use comments in the inputs to indicate which term is which
Guillaume

Oh. The term 'M' in the 'SplitCHWRes' denotes M_c. I must revise it to M_c.
The solution converges well nonetheless reliability of the result. I'm now going to check it.
Thank you for help.
Woojin

I found it does not work well..!
If I set temperature profile in first order, that should be no change in the result cause it has two gradient.
But it represents different result even though I set first order temperature profile.
I should make new kernel. Thanks.
Woojin

node.title: Displacment values are not showing correctly as expected
node.bodyText:
Hi,
I tried to do  displacement analysis by pulling a plate from two opposites side on X axis by 0.001. Using Bond Based Peridynamics and horizon number =1, the displacment along X direction is coming correctly as expected. But displacement along Y direction is obtained as zero irrespective of what the material property is. It seems like Problems are treated as truss structures as element type is EDGE2. What can I do?
The Code written is as follows.
elem = QUAD4
[GlobalParams]
  displacements = 'disp_x disp_y'
[]

L=1.0
B=1.0
Hor_num=1
dimension=2
xn=10
yn=10
delx=${fparse L/xn}
dely=${fparse L/xn}
M_L_min=${fparse -delx/2}
M_L_max=${fparse L+delx/2}
M_B_min=${fparse -dely/2}
M_B_max=${fparse B+dely/2}
M_nx=${fparse xn+1}
M_ny=${fparse yn+1}
YM=1000
PR=0.3
[Mesh]
  type = PeridynamicsMesh
  horizon_number = ${Hor_num}
  [Mainsec]
    type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
    dim = ${dimension}
    xmin = ${M_L_min}
    xmax = ${M_L_max}
    ymin = ${M_B_min}
    ymax = ${M_B_max}
    nx = ${M_nx}
    ny = ${M_ny}
    elem_type = ${elem}
    boundary_name_prefix = Mainsec
    boundary_id_offset = 10
  []
  [./gpd]
    type = MeshGeneratorPD
    input = Mainsec
    retain_fe_mesh = false
  [../]
[]

[Variables]
  [./disp_x]
  [../]
  [./disp_y]
  [../]
[]

[BCs]
  [./left_x1]
    type = FunctionDirichletBC
    variable = disp_x
    boundary = 1013
    function = '-0.001 * t'
  [../]
  [./right_x1]
    type = FunctionDirichletBC
    variable = disp_x
    boundary = 1011
    function = '0.001 * t'
  [../]
[]

[Modules/Peridynamics/Mechanics/Master]
  [./all]
    formulation = BOND
  [../]
[]

[Materials]
  [./elasticity_tensor]
    type = ComputeIsotropicElasticityTensor
    youngs_modulus = ${YM}
    poissons_ratio = ${PR}
  [../]

  [./force_density]
    type =  ComputeSmallStrainConstantHorizonMaterialBPD
	plane_stress=true
  [../]
[]

[Preconditioning]
  [./SMP]
    type = SMP
    full = true
  [../]
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  solve_type = NEWTON
  end_time = 1
  dt = 1
  num_steps = 1
[]
[Outputs]
  exodus = true
[]
@hchen139 @laagesen
Sorry, afraid peridynamics is not in my wheelhouse. I think a lot of this capability was added by someone who is no longer at INL, I cannot remember the name but @bwspenc might remember who it was

Briefly looked at your input file. There are at least two major issues. First, using Hor_num=1 indicates you only consider the interaction with the nearest four neighboring elements. A recommended value is 3. Second, you didn't impose sufficient boundary conditions to fully constrain your problem. What is/are the constraint(s) for disp_y?

For Hor_num=3, I tried changing Poisson's ratio and also tried plane stress case, but displacement values along Y-direction obtained is found to be same irrespective of these changes in material properties.

node.title: How to register a task to build user objects
Unable to solve environment when installing moose
node.bodyText:
Hi All,
I am installing Moose using the Conda Moose Environment and running into difficulties when trying to install moose ->
(base) rsmith@ubuntu:$ export PATH=$HOME/miniconda3/bin:$PATH
(base) rsmith@ubuntu:$ conda config --add channels conda-forge
Warning: 'conda-forge' already in 'channels' list, moving to the top
(base) rsmith@ubuntu:$ conda config --add channels idaholab
Warning: 'idaholab' already in 'channels' list, moving to the top
(base) rsmith@ubuntu:$ conda create --name moose moose-libmesh moose-tools
Collecting package metadata (current_repodata.json): done
Solving environment: failed with repodata from current_repodata.json, will retry with next repodata source.
Collecting package metadata (repodata.json): done
Solving environment: - Killed
I am unable to solve the environment and it kills the process. Any fixes/advice/recommendations?
Cheers
Having conda just die like that could happen when it runs out of memory. How much memory do you have on your machine?

Hi Logan,
My computer has 8gb but I am giving my virtual machine 2gb. Is that enough?
Storage wise, it has 20gb.
Cheers
I would try upping it to 3 or 4GB to see if you still get the same issue.
Thanks Logan that has worked! Nothing like a bit of extra juice for the system!
Sure thing! Sorry that the error isn't particularly useful :-)
@loganharbour Im having similar issues while updating MOOSE, can you please clarify how to increase the memory as you suggested ? Want to give it a try. Thanks.

@maqsiddiqui, whatever virtual machine software you are using, you'll want to search the internet on how to do that. As that is what anyone in our group will be doing (WSL, Parallels, VMware, Docker, VirtualBox, etc).
